meta.Summary::
The Rail Accident Investigation Branch (RAIB) has released a report today with three sections into adhesion-related incidents. The third section is a review of adhesion related incidents during the Autumn of 2005.
The broader investigation into the adhesion performance during autumn 2005, part 3 of the report, resulted in the RAIB making 19 recommendations.

title: Autumn Adhesion Incidents - Part One - Esher - Part Two - Lewes - Part Three - Adhesion
raw_html:
Report name:
070108_R252006_Adhesion_Part1
Incident date:
25 November 2005
Category:
Heavy Rail
Summary:
The Rail Accident Investigation Branch (RAIB) has released a report today with three sections into adhesion-related incidents. The first section covers signals passed at danger at Esher on 25 November 2005. The RAIB made three recommendations relating to issues that were specific to the incident at Esher.
Download report:
070108_R252006_Part_1_Esher.pdf (1,379.49 kb)

The third section is a review of adhesion related incidents during the Autumn of 2005. The broader investigation into the adhesion performance during autumn 2005, part 3 of the report, resulted in the RAIB making 19 recommendations.

body:
The Rail Accident Investigation Branch (RAIB) has released a report today with three sections into adhesion-related incidents. The first section covers signals passed at danger at Esher on 25 November 2005. The RAIB made three recommendations relating to issues that were specific to the incident at Esher.

  
[ASSET_TAG](#ASSET0) (1,379.49 kb) 

  
The Rail Accident Investigation Branch (RAIB) has released a report today with three sections into adhesion-related incidents. The second section covers a signal passed at danger at Lewes on 30 November 2005. The RAIB made three recommendations relating to issues that were specific to the incident at Lewes.

The Rail Accident Investigation Branch (RAIB) has released a report today with three sections into adhesion-related incidents. The third section is a review of adhesion related incidents during the Autumn of 2005. The broader investigation into the adhesion performance during autumn 2005, part 3 of the report, resulted in the RAIB making 19 recommendations.
